events.originalText: Julia Gillard (pictured) was sworn in as the first female prime minister of Australia after incumbent Kevin Rudd declined to contest a leadership spill in the Labor Party.
events.subtitle: Julia Gillard
events.headline: Julia Gillard sworn in as first female prime minister of Australia

events.originalText: John Isner defeated Nicolas Mahut at the Wimbledon Championships, concluding the longest match in tennis history, which lasted 11 hours and 5 minutes over three days.
events.subtitle: John Isner
events.headline: John Isner defeats Nicolas Mahut in longest tennis match in history

events.originalText: Following the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre the 13th Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party appointed Jiang Zemin (pictured) as general secretary in place of Zhao Ziyang.
events.subtitle: 1989 Tiananmen Square protests and massacre
events.headline: Jiang Zemin appointed general secretary after Tiananmen Square massacre

events.originalText: Amid racial tensions, U.S. Army military police shot and killed a black serviceman after a confrontation at a pub in Bamber Bridge, England.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: US Army military police shoot and kill black serviceman in England

events.originalText: Second World War: The British Army carried out Operation Collar, its first commando raid into German-occupied France.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British Army carries out Operation Collar in German-occupied France

events.originalText: The first of the Thai cultural mandates was issued, officially changing the country's name from Siam to Thailand.
events.subtitle: Thai cultural mandates
events.headline: Thailand officially changes name from Siam with cultural mandate

events.originalText: The U.S. Navy's first two fast battleships, North Carolina and Washington, of the North Carolina class, were respectively ordered from the New York and Philadelphia Naval Shipyards.
events.subtitle: Fast battleship
events.headline: US Navy orders first two fast battleships from Naval Shipyards

events.originalText: A group of military officers and civilians engineered a bloodless coup in Siam, ending the absolute rule of the Chakri dynasty.
events.subtitle: Siamese revolution of 1932
events.headline: Bloodless coup in Siam ends Chakri dynasty's rule

events.originalText: "O Canada", the present-day national anthem of Canada, was first performed in Quebec City during a Saint-Jean-Baptiste Day banquet.
events.subtitle: O Canada
events.headline: "O Canada" national anthem first performed in Quebec City

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: Led by Napoleon, the French Grande Armée crossed the Neman, beginning their invasion of Russia.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: French Grande Armée crosses Neman to invade Russia

events.originalText: The first Grand Lodge of Freemasonry, the Premier Grand Lodge of England, was founded in London.
events.subtitle: Grand Lodge
events.headline: Premier Grand Lodge of England founded in London

events.originalText: The 1559 Book of Common Prayer, a major component of the Elizabethan Religious Settlement, is legally introduced as the liturgy of the Church of England.
events.subtitle: Book of Common Prayer (1559)
events.headline: Book of Common Prayer introduced as liturgy of Church of England

events.originalText: An outbreak of dancing mania, in which crowds of people danced themselves to exhaustion, began in Aachen (in present-day Germany) before spreading to other parts of Europe.
events.subtitle: Dancing mania
events.headline: Outbreak of dancing mania begins in Aachen, spreads across Europe

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: The English fleet commanded by Edward III almost completely destroyed the French fleet at the Battle of Sluys.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: English fleet destroys French fleet at Battle of Sluys

events.originalText: In the decisive battle of the First War of Scottish Independence, Scottish forces led by Robert the Bruce defeated English troops under Edward II near Bannockburn, Scotland.
events.subtitle: First War of Scottish Independence
events.headline: Robert the Bruce defeats Edward II at Battle of Bannockburn

events.originalText: Western Roman emperor Glycerius, who was not recognized by his Eastern counterpart Leo I, was forced to abdicate.
events.subtitle: Western Roman Empire
events.headline: Western Roman emperor Glycerius forced to abdicate
